oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written by Cyrus DeLany, Co. B, 30th Ohio Inf. Regt., USA to his brother
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cyrus DeLany writes this letter to his brother about the adjutancy of the regiment and serving as a clerk but unable to please Colonel Ewing. He complains about some of the privates in the regiment and wishes he could go to West Point. The 30th Ohio initially served in Virginia and Maryland but after the battle Antietam were transferred to the Army of the Tennessee and fought at Vicksburg, Chattanooga, the Atlanta Campaign, and the Campaigns in the Carolinas.
